results.title: Boundaries of the heart
results.creator_credit: Lex Marinos, Patric Juillet, FGH Film Consortium and Tra La La Films
results.brief_description: Depicts life in an outback Australian town, centring on a small town belle who has become bitter and stilted. She is alienating her family friends and shearer boyfriend and after many humiliations, she faces a bleak and lonely future. Stars Wendy Hughes, John Hargreaves and Norman Kaye.

results.title: Emoh ruo
results.creator_credit: Denny Lawrence, David Elfick, Palm Beach Pictures and UAA Films
results.brief_description: Australian satire about the Tunkley family and the trouble they encounter when they buy their first home. Stars Joy Smithers and Martin Sacks.

results.title: Rikky and Pete = Rikky & Pete
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, David Parker and Cascade Films
results.brief_description: Rikky is a talented and would be singer and her brother, Pete, is a mechanical genius. After Pete pulls one practical joke too many, they escape Melbourne for an adventure in the outback eventually finding themselves amongst the characters of a mining town. Stars Stephen Kearney and Nina Landis with Bill Hunter, Bruno Lawrence and Bruce Spence in supporting roles.

results.title: The Return of Captain Invincible
results.creator_credit: Philippe Mora, Seven Keys and Willarra
results.brief_description: Captain Invincible was once the world’s greatest super-hero before he was falsely accused of treason and dishonourably discharged from active service 30 years ago. The United States President calls on his childhood hero, now aging and an alcoholic, to save the world from the evil Mr Midnight. Stars Alan Arkin, Christopher Lee with Kate Fitzpatrick, Bill Hunter and Graham Kennedy.

results.title: Roadgames = Road games (D)
results.brief_description: A psychopathic killer is haunting the Nullarbor Highway in search of female hitch-hikers whom he picks up, rapes, kills and dismembers. An eccentric, long-haul truck driver determines to track down the murderer and is helped by a young hitch-hiker he picks up. Stars Stacy Keach and Jamie Lee Curtis.

results.title: The Removalists
results.brief_description: The story is the tragedy of a young police constable, new to the force and tongue-tied with inhibitions. Circumstances move him to murder, not only of a man, but also of his own morality. The dialogue - screenplay by David Williamson - is a unique combination of irony, cynicism, naivety and vulgar vitality, and the film explores subtle relationships. Based on the play by David Williamson. Stars John Hargreaves, Peter Cummins, Kate Fitzpatrick, Jacki Weaver and Chris Haywood.

Literature → Australian literature - Film and video adaptations

results.title: Eden's Lost
results.creator_credit: Neil Armfield, Margaret Fink, ABC-TV (Australia) and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: Based on a novel by Sumner Locke Elliott, this is the story of Angus Weekes and the unusual family of Eve St. James. Taken in by Eve after the death of his guardian, Angus cannot resist becoming involved in the ultimately tragic patterns of their lives. This is ‘art-television’ in the BBC tradition of literary adaptation. Like the novel it is structured in three parts. ‘Angus’ (episode I) is the most Gothic and melodramatic in structure and tone; ‘Bea’ (episode II) is the most naturalistic and ‘Eve’ (episode III) is the most concentrated and formally rigorous. Cast includes Julia Blake, Arthur Dignam, Linda Cropper, Victoria Longley and Bruce Hughes.

results.title: Tim
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Colleen McCullough this is the story of an affair between an older woman and a young intellectually disabled man she meets when he becomes her gardener. Starring Piper Laurie and Mel Gibson.

results.title: The Earthling
results.creator_credit: Peter Collinson, Elliot Schick, John Strong and Samuel Z Arkoff
results.brief_description: Patrick Foley, dying presumably of cancer, returns from America to his outback country town. There, after the briefest of conversations with long-lost acquaintances, he sets off over the mountains to a remote and hidden valley where his father once carved out a small farm. On his way, he comes accross Shawn Daley, who has just seen his mother and father die in a campervan accident. Lost, angry and afraid, Shawn seeks Patrick’s help but is coldly rebuffed. The irascible Patrick wants nothing to do with anybody else and tells the boy he must fend for himself. Shawn has no choice but to keep hounding Patrick, and the rest of the film is the changing relationship between this dying man and a dependent child. Cast includes William Holden, Ricky Schroder, Jack Thompson and Olivia Hamnett.

results.title: Summerfield
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Patricia Lovell and Clare Beach Films
results.brief_description: When a newcomer arrives in a small, secluded town to discover that the former teacher has disappeared, he probes into the mystery and becomes more and more intrigued by the inhabitants of a forbidding house called Summerfield. Eventually, the secrets of Summerfield are revealed in a dramatic ending with a shock twist. Directed by Ken Hannam (director of ‘Sunday Too Far Away’) and starring, Nick Tate, Elizabeth Alexander and John Waters, ‘Summerfield’ was shot on location at Victoria’s Phillip and Churchill Islands.
